DoNotCallGarbageCollectionExplicitly.description:
Description

Calls toSystem.gc(),Runtime.getRuntime().gc(), andSystem.runFinalization()are not advised.
Code should have the same behavior whether the garbage collection is disabled using the option-Xdisableexplicitgcor not.

Moreover, "modern" JVMs do a very good job handling garbage collections. If memory usage issues unrelated to memory
leaks develop within an application, it should be dealt with JVM options rather than within the code itself.

Example(s):

Use this rule by referencing it:
DoNotCallGarbageCollectionExplicitly.option: This rule has no specific options.
